channel.title: A sneak peak of hybridscape final and the basics of the packet system
channel.description:
Mind you i converted it to just do a quick demo however you can see with this demo just how flexible the packet system is. once you get it loaded up with either intellij, or apache ant feel free to use any deob 317 client on it. it will do the whole login packet for ya and print the user name and password. of course this is nothing spectacular but i felt a demo was nessesary. to show that their are other methods to the whole private server idea. feel free to comment or not or do the usual what the hell is this.
http://dnd.no-ip.org/hybridscapefinal.rar

item.title: A sneak peak of hybridscape final and the basics of the packet system

@silabsoft wrote:

rscd has sql stuff started it was just never implimented.

Read full topic

item.title: A sneak peak of hybridscape final and the basics of the packet system
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Very nice Miss Silabsoft, Could help me in my development of my idea of a rsc sql based server.
By sql based i mean alot of it will be stored in sql databases…
Just an experiment really and maybe an attempt at bringing that section back to life.

EDIT: My Crappy spelling

item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

indeed, i said from the beginning that rscd way of packethandling was great and needed to be utilized, and the playerlogin was just something i pulled out of the hybridscape client so no harm their :p.

item.title: A sneak peak of hybridscape final and the basics of the packet system
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Having read over it quickly, it looks like you borrowed quite a lot of the RSCD source. That, and the PlayerLogin class shouldn’t be named ‘playerLogin’.

Read full topic
